com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.ui.tabs

Class FragmentCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.ui.tabs.FragmentCalendar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, OnSyncCalendarListener, SavedStateCompatible

    public class FragmentCalendar
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
implements SavedStateCompatible, OnSyncCalendarListener
    A fragment containing the view for the calendar tab.

        savedState - bundle of saved state, must not be null
        root - the root view of this tab

      • syncCalendar

        public void syncCalendar()
        Called when the button to sync the calendar is pressed. This will assert that the app has permission to use the calendar API, then create the calendar on the system and create events on the calendar for each subscription's payment dates.
        Specified by:
        syncCalendar in interface OnSyncCalendarListener

      • handleRequestResult

        public void handleRequestResult(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                @NonNull
                                int[] grantResults)
        Handles the outcome of requesting a permission. If the calendar permissions are requested, the overridden method in the parent activity will call this to handle it. This method checks to see if both permissions are granted, and calls the sync calendar method if they are; otherwise, it displays a message saying permission is denied.
        Specified by:
        handleRequestResult in interface OnSyncCalendarListener
        Parameters:
        permissions - an array of permissions that were requested
        grantResults - an array of integers showing the results of those permission requests

      • handleSyncResult

        public void handleSyncResult(int result)
        Handles the outcome of the calendar sync thread. When the process of syncing the calendar is run on a separate thread, that thread should keep an instance of this class with it and call this method when it's done. The result it sends should be one of the SYNC_THREAD_... integer codes in the interface. This implementation will send the code to this class' sync thread handler on the UI thread.
        Specified by:
        handleSyncResult in interface OnSyncCalendarListener
        Parameters:
        result - a sync thread code denoting how the process finished

      • updateSubList

        private void updateSubList(android.view.View view,
                           java.util.Date date)
        Update the UI component that displays a list of subscriptions depending on what day on the calendar is pressed.
        Parameters:
        view - the current view to display to
        date - the date pressed on the calendar, so this should display the subscriptions that have a payment due on that date

      • removeOnlySubViews

        private void removeOnlySubViews(android.widget.LinearLayout linearLayout)
        Given a linear layout, remove from it only child views that are SubscriptionView objects. This will leave any views that aren't subscription views still in the layout.
        Parameters:
        linearLayout - the linear layout to modify in place

      • updateCalendarTabOnDayPress

        private void updateCalendarTabOnDayPress(java.util.Date date,
                                         android.view.View root)
        The full procedure the calendar tab does each time a date is pressed. First, the list of subscriptions due on the date pressed will be updated, then the text above that list will be changed to reflect the date selected.
        Parameters:
        date - the date selected on the calendar
        root - the root view of this tab

      • requestCalendarPermissions

        private void requestCalendarPermissions(android.app.Activity parentActivity)
        Puts in a request for the read and write calendar permissions from the system, which the user must accept or deny. If indicated, this can also give additional information about why the permissions are needed before giving the option to choose.
        Parameters:
        parentActivity - the parent activity of this fragment
